elementMetadata.description: Add a SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) Instance to connect your existing SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) account to the CRM Hub, allowing you to manage accounts, contacts, leads, opportunities, etc. across multiple CRM Elements. You will need your SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) account information to add an instance.
elementMetadata.name: SAP Hybris Cloud for Customer CRM

configuration.description: SAP C4C CRM Max Page Size (or limit)
configuration.name: Max Page Size (or limit)

configuration.description: Update the bulk query to use the resource defined fields
configuration.name: Bulk Query Field update

configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector
configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter

configuration.description: The date format for the response field
configuration.name: Bulk Query Date Mask on response

configuration.defaultValue: ChangedOn, CreatedOn, ETag, LastUpdatedOn, UpdatedOn, EndDateTime, CreatedOnDateTime, ReportedDateTime, StartDateTime, CreationOn, DateTime, DateOfBirth, BirthDate, ProcessingDatePeriod,CreationDateTime, IndividualCustomerBirthDate, CloseDate, LastChangeDate, LastChangeDateTime, DueDateTime, RevenueEndDate, RevenueStartDate, DueEndDateTime, CompletedOnDate, CompletionDueDate, InitialResponseDate, InitialReviewDueDate, LastResponseOnDate, NextResponseDueDate, ReferenceDate, WarrantyFrom, WarrantyTo, CompletionDateTime, Date, TimeItemEndDate, TimeItemEndTime, TimeItemStartDate, ChangedOnDateTime
configuration.description: String of the SAP ODATA Date Fields which need to include the 'datetimeoffset' for $filter queries
configuration.name: SAP ODATA Date Time Offset Fields

configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses
configuration.name: Filter null values from the response

configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings
configuration.name: Default select fields

configuration.description: The time (in ms) that the Provision Authentication Validation call was completed
configuration.name: Authentication Time

configuration.description: Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)
configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval

configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - { "contacts": { "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts", “idField”: “user.id”, “datesConfiguration”: { "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at", "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX", “createdDateField”: “user.created_at”, “createdDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX" }, "pageSize": 10000 } }
configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration

objects.description: The Contact collection provides the contact information of a particular account. The Contacts are organized based on the accounts from where they originate from. A contact can be related to multiple Accounts/Contacts or can be related to a single account
objects.name: contacts

objects.description: The Opportunity collection provides information about all opportunities, and these opportunities represent potential sales. They can be displayed, edited, and even new ones can be created
objects.name: opportunities

objects.description: The Account collection provides information about corporate customers and prospects. These are existing organizations and potential customers for the company
objects.name: accounts

objects.description: The Lead collection(LeanLead) represents an individual or organization that a company has the potential to do business with and is based on a similar SAP CRM functionality
objects.name: leads

objects.description: A document, image, or other attachment for a account, lead, contact, or opportunity
objects.name: attachments

description: Add a SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) Instance to connect your existing SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) account to the CRM Hub, allowing you to manage accounts, contacts, leads, opportunities, etc. across multiple CRM Elements. You will need your SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) account information to add an instance.

resources.description: Search for leads. Note: results may come back empty without a where clause filter

leadsListObject.description: The Lead collection(LeanLead) represents an individual or organization that a company has the potential to do business with and is based on a similar SAP CRM functionality.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. Simple comparisons, ('=', '!=', '<', "<=', '>', '>=', 'LIKE', 'AND', 'OR') are supported. An example date query would be: CreationDateTime > '2016-04-28T03:49:32Z' for datetimeoffset and for datetime like StartDate > '2015-06-28T04:55:34' . An example LIKE query may be ContactName LIKE 'Example%'

parameters.name: returnTotalCount
parameters.description: Optionally return the total count of records. Setting to false will reduce the latency of the request for the downstream vendor. Defaults to true

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number. Defaults to 1 if not provided

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size. Defaults to 200 if not provided

parameters.name: allpages
parameters.description: Include how many responses there were...

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The expand related objects, used to request additional objects (in csv format) to be sent on the response . Note: this can slow down the response time considerably

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to search, e.g., 'account'.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for objects that were last modified on or after 'Jan 15, 2014', the search expression will be where=lastModifiedDate>='2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. When this parameter is omitted, all objects of the given type are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: childObjectName
parameters.description: The child object name, e.g., comments

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The expand related objects, used to request additional objects (in csv format) to be sent on the response . Note: this can slow down the response time considerably

parameters.name: allpages
parameters.description: Include how many responses there were...

resources.description: Find objects in the CRM system, using the provided object name and CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all contacts whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned

parameters.name: returnTotalCount
parameters.description: Optionally return the total count of records. Setting to false will reduce the latency of the request for the downstream vendor. Defaults to true

parameters.name: allpages
parameters.description: Include how many responses there were...

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for objects that were last modified on or after 'Jan 15, 2014', the search expression will be where=lastModifiedDate>='2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. When this parameter is omitted, all objects of the given type are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to search, e.g., 'account'.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

resources.description: Update an object associated with a given object name and ID in the CRM system. The update API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left alone.Updating an object with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be updated, e.g., 'account'.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The object with those fields that are to be updated.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the object to update in the CRM system.

resources.description: Update an object associated with a given object name and ID in the CRM system. Updating an object with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The object with those fields that are to be updated.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be updated, e.g., 'account'.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the object to update in the CRM system.

resources.description: Create an attachment for an {objectName}. You must specify the attachment object as a {childObjectName}

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Include specify metadata about the attachment in json format. Possible fields: `TypeCode`, `CategoryCode`, `FileName`. Defaults to a standard document attachment upload with the existing filename of the file

parameters.name: multipart/form-data
parameters.description: The required header

parameters.description: The object name, e.g., accounts

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The object ID

parameters.name: childObjectName
parameters.description: The child object name, e.g., attachment

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded

resources.description: Create a new object in the CRM system. The provided objectName can be that of a custom or standard object. Object creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The object to be created.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be created, e.g., 'account'

resources.description: Ping the Element to confirm that the Hub Element has a heartbeat. If the Element does not have a heartbeat, an error message will be returned.

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page
